etymology.description: Depicts a hook or barb -> used as a basic component in characters like 了(了) (liǎo, 'to finish'), 予(予) (yǔ, 'give'), 事(事) (shì, 'affair')
etymology.interpretation: 亅(亅) (jué, 'hook') visually represents a simple hook or barb shape, which is utilized as a foundational stroke and component in the construction of various Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: 这个汉字的笔划中包含了亅这一笔(這個漢字的筆劃中包含了亅這一筆)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège hànzì de bǐhuà zhōng bāohánle jué zhè yī bǐ.
examples.english: This character’s strokes include a hook stroke.

examples.chinese: 古代铭文中(古代銘文中)，常用亅来构形(常用亅來構形)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài míngwén zhōng, cháng yòng jué lái gòuxíng.
examples.english: In ancient inscriptions, hook was commonly used in character formation.
